sentences.sContent: For 150 years, Braille books were designed to function as much as possible like print books.
sentences.sContent_eng: For 150 years, Braille books were designed to function as much as possible like print books.
sentences.sCn: 150年来，布莱叶盲文书籍设计的功能尽可能做到与印刷图书相同。

sentences.sContent: At the convention this statistic was frequently cited with pride, so much so that those who didn’t know Braille were sometimes made to feel like outsiders.
sentences.sContent_eng: At the convention this statistic was frequently cited with pride, so much so that those who didn’t know Braille were sometimes made to feel like outsiders.
sentences.sCn: 在国家盲人联合会的年会上，这个研究数据经常被引用，以至于那些没学过布莱叶的人觉得自己像个局外人。

trans.tranCn: 布莱叶（法国盲人教育家）；盲人用点字法
trans.tranOther: Braille is a system of printing for blind people. The letters are printed as groups of raised dots that you can feel with your fingers.
